articles.description: SAN FRANCISCO: Facebook on Tuesday (Sep 3) confirmed it is dabbling with no longer making a public display of how many "likes" are racked up by posts.

articles.description: It's easy to take and view burst photos on your iPhone using the Camera app's burst mode, which captures images at 10 frames per second. Here's how.

articles.title: Huawei plans high-end phone launch despite lack of Google apps and services - South China Morning Post
articles.description: Huawei Technologies plans to forge ahead with the launch of new high-end smartphones in Europe even though it may not be able to offer Google’s official Android operating system and widely used apps such as Google Maps, company executives told Reuters.
articles.content:
